title: Internship Interview

title: Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Greenpeace in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: My interview was at Pune office. There were 2 interviews, one was a preliminary one. The next one was was taken by a senior professional. If all goes well through both the interviews, you are on your way to becoming a fundraiser. After that, you will undergo training of 3 days. Then they will keep u on observation period of a week during which you have to observe how they work. You may then start your job as soon as the next week starts. No-stress & fun-filled work. U will find reat people to work with. Salary is : 10 k+ incentives + daily fuel allowance of 100Rs. I dont' think that there can be any better job for a graduate than this. :)
Interview Questions: Why do want to get into NGO sice you have done engineering as graduation ?

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Greenpeace (New Delhi) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: You have to apply through a portal called Jobvite. If your application is shortlisted, you will get a call from either the HR/the concerned department. There is one round of phone interview and then you are called down for a F2F interview with the concerned department. If you meet the criteria they are looking for, then you will be selected and they will make you an offer. If you do not get selected, they are quite prompt in letting you know.
Interview Questions: What social causes do you feel passionate about and why?

title: Communications Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Greenpeace (Bengaluru)
Interview Descriptions: Starts with an intention to be rigorous but opposite pulls threaten the rigour - urgent need to hire versus need to comply with process. High attrition in Communications leaves line managers and HR little bandwidth to fully leverage the rigour desired. Hasty hires create ripple effects across the organization and often make whole departments shaky.
Interview Questions: How can Greenpeace build up a mass movement

title: Climate and Energy Cmapaigner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Greenpeace (Bengaluru) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward, 2 telephonic rounds and one face to face and one round with the HR.well bassic backround check followed with the expectations and a ppt presentation on a topic which is given to u couple of days back
Interview Questions: What do think about the current energy trend in the country and how does the govt sees it
